3.content:
[Name: Abel]
[Type: Principality / Imperial Seat]
[Capital: Archangel]
[Population: 10,000,000+]
[Atmosphere: Abel is the vibrant, prosperous heart of human civilization. Its great cities are a stunning mix of architectural beauty and immense scale, connected by the only fully paved road system in the world. The lands are vast, green, and safe, teeming with life under a warm, if often rainy, climate. A palpable sense of optimistic progress and cultural openness defines the society, which strives to move past recent tragedies and rally behind its young Empress toward a brilliant future.]
[Data:
    Fact_Sheet[
        Government(Imperial autocracy, directly ruled by the Empress),
        Main_Ethnic_Groups(Asher 41%, Aion 39%, Vildianos 7%, Sinner 4%, Ryuan 4%),
        Languages(Latin, with minority use of Ailish and Yamato),
        Religion(Christianity, with a growing number of openly atheist citizens following a recent imperial edict),
        Technology_Level(5),
        Denomym(Abelense),
        Flag(A rampant lion on a white background),
        Masculine_Names(Aileron, Aurelius, Cassius, Dante, Dominic, Gaius, Janus, Marcus, Maximilian, Nero, Nox, Silas, Solaris, Vicent, Virgil),
        Feminine_Names(Alma, Angelica, Ardelis, Celia, Dawn, Drucilla, Emma, Gloria, Integra, Levenia, Maris, Minerva, Priscilla, Shanna, Shion, Tricia, Zia),
        Last_Names(Agius, Anderson, Attard, Borges, Brakys, Cassar, Durand, Faria, Galea, Grech, Laurens, Lynch, Major, Martius, Morison, Reid, Vicens)
    ],
    Geography_and_Economy[
        Terrain(enormous green plains, leafy forests, great rivers, delineated by two mountain ranges),
        Climate(warm, with frequent rains and occasional strong storms),
        Infrastructure(all roads connecting major cities are paved),
        Resources(exceptionally rich in livestock, agriculture, and mining),
        Economy(self-sufficient; combines a modern manufacturing infrastructure with powerful guilds, acting as a major trade hub for the world)
    ],
    Government_and_Military[
        Ruler(Empress Elisabetta Barbados, a young girl who wields all imperial powers),
        Advisors(she listens only to Tadeus Van Horsman and her Heaven Order mentor, Kisidan),
        Military_Structure(lacks a large standing army, but the Empress controls the most powerful Lords of War and her personal bodyguards, the Knights of the Heaven Order)
    ],
    Culture_and_Society[
        Core_Values(cultural openness and ethnic diversity, inheriting the prosperity of the old Empire of Solomon),
        Social_Structure(three classes: nobility, clergy, and common folk, but not a closed hierarchy),
        Social_Mobility(the high bourgeoisie can accede to noble titles through marriage or payment),
        Feudal_System(not very established; most nobility resides in major cities or the Imperial Court rather than independent castles),
        Local_Governance(cities are ruled by an Imperially-appointed noble, but a mayor chosen by the citizens acts as a civil governor)
    ],
    Supernatural_Views[
        Public_Attitude(tolerant of minor, non-harmful displays of superhuman ability, often justifying them as 'gifts from God' seen in the Heaven Order),
        The_Line(fearful of grand-scale, flashy, or dark-looking magic, which is labeled as 'witchcraft' or 'demonic'),
        Public_Reaction(citizens will file formal accusations with The Inquisition for overt magic use, but lynchings are unheard of; trials are always conducted first)
    ],
    Key_Events_and_Symbols[
        The_Lion_Emblem(a sacred animal symbolizing the Empire, originating from Arturia, the white lion that died saving Emperor Zhorne Giovanni. Hunting lions is strictly forbidden),
        Tao_Zan_Tournament(an official fighting competition held every three years in Archangel's coliseum. It is a major cultural event where killing is forbidden but most combat styles are allowed)
    ],
    History[
        Ancient_Origins(rose from the barren lands of the nomadic Lineage of Solomon, which became the first human empire and developed incredible magical and technological wonders),
        The_Collapse(the Empire of Solomon eventually collapsed and its knowledge was lost; its descendants were overtaken by the arrival of the Messiah),
        The_Holy_Kingdom(the area was renamed Abel, becoming the center of Christianity under Apostle Pietro Giovanni, with Archangel built on Solomon's old capital),
        The_War_of_God(the armies of Rah devastated Abel, punishing it most severely),
        The_New_Empire(in 233, Zhorne Giovanni founded the Sacred Holy Empire of Abel with the war refugees, which has been the heart of the Empire for seven centuries)
    ],
    Current_Affairs[
        Political_Situation(disturbing tensions with secessionist principalities, especially Togarini and the Azur Alliance on the southern border),
        Empress's_Position(many feel the Imperial Crown is too much for a young girl to handle, though most of Abel's population supports her)
    ]
]

6.content:
Type: Village / Town / Settlement
Population: Unknown
Description: No information has been provided from the source material of Anima Beyond Fantasy.

7.content:
[Name: Leazhar]
[Type: Village]
[Parent: Abel]
[Atmosphere: Leazhar is an ancient and quiet village that feels unstuck in time. Its handful of low, stacked stone buildings exude a sense of immense, yet unremarkable, history. The atmosphere is one of peaceful, rustic simplicity, as its citizens go about their farming lives with no interest in the past. Recently, however, this tranquility has been overlaid with a subtle tension and suspicion, brought by the arrival of a mysterious, wealthy newcomer and his well-armed mercenaries.]
[Data:
History(the oldest town in the Empire, built 2,500 years ago during the Era of Solomon);
Historical_Significance(disappointed historians centuries ago as it contained no ancient technology or great findings, only simple houses and corrals);
Current_State(receives few visitors as it is miles from any commercial route; its citizens are farmers with little interest in the outside world);
Recent_Events[
New_Owner(in the last few years, many houses have been acquired by Cristophe De Gaulle),
Public_Goal(De Gaulle claims he plans to revitalize the town into a commercial hub),
Rumors(he is rumored to be carrying out secret excavations under the homes),
Personnel(he is accompanied by a team of well-trained mercenaries, many with supernatural abilities)
],
Imperial_Response[
Initial_Investigation(Imperial supervisors found no proof of excavations),
Covert_Action(fearing the discovery of a Lost Logias, Abel has sent a covert agent),
Agent_Profile(Anka Grimbergel, Technician Lv. 4, ♀, a member of the Heaven Order),
Agent_Status(Anka is living in the village incognito, posing as a farmer while monitoring Cristophe's movements)
]
]

9.content:

10.content:

15.content:
[Name: Archangel]
[Type: Metropolis / Imperial Capital]
[Parent: Abel]
[Population: 2,850,000+]
[Atmosphere: Archangel is the undisputed heart of civilization, a city of breathtaking scale and lavish, monumental beauty. Its streets, illuminated by artificial lighting, are a testament to progress and imperial power, blending ancient, mysterious structures with glorious baroque architecture. The city radiates an aura of immense wealth, historical significance, and unparalleled security, with the iconic, winged angel statue watching over it all as a symbol of its divine right to rule.]
[Data:
History[
Origin(built on the ruins of the Empire of Solomon a year after the Messiah's death),
War_of_God(was nearly destroyed, then reconstructed into the metropolis it is today)
],
Infrastructure(the epitome of modernization, with an artificial lighting system, running water, and a sewer system),
Architecture(a mix of ancient Solomon-era structures and a dominant, glorious baroque style from the last seven centuries),
Major_Landmarks[
Three_Great_Fortresses(the Castle of Averus for the Lord of War, the Imperial Castle for the Empress, and the unoccupied Vatican Cathedral),
Monuments(the Museum of History and Art, the Chapel of the Resurrection where Abel is buried, the Passage of the Eras hall of heroes),
Guardian_Statue(the city's most representative monument, a gigantic white marble column crowned by an immense angel)
],
Governance[
Ruler(Empress Elisabetta Barbados herself),
System(a municipal system with civil governors who report to an imperial delegate called the Praetor)
],
Security(considered one of the safest places to live due to the constant presence of The Knights of the Heaven Order as guards),
Secret_Presence[
Samael(a considerable number of Samael members live secretly within the city, some having attained social positions),
Solomon_Ruins(unknown to almost everyone, the most important architectural relics of Solomon, including many Lost Logias, are hidden beneath the city)
]
]

21.content:
[Name: The Tower of Babel]
[Type: Ruins / Lost Logias]
[Parent: The Balthus Mountains]
[Atmosphere: The Tower of Babel is a place of profound, high-tech mystery and dread. The tall, black metal cylinder feels utterly alien, as if it fell from the heavens rather than being built. Its interior is a cold, metallic labyrinth of strange apparatuses, made deeply unsettling by walls lined with mechanical statues resembling the Grim Reaper. The entire structure radiates an aura of immense, latent power and terrifying, unknown purpose.]
[Data:
Identity(one of the greatest known remains of a Lost Logias);
Secrecy(its existence has been kept an absolute secret by the Sacred Holy Empire for over four centuries);
Recent_History[
Initial_Action(Emperor Elias sent a scientific team to uncover its secrets a year ago),
Current_Status(Empress Elisabetta has kept the team there, reinforcing their security with concealed Knights of the Fifth Heaven)
],
Appearance[
Exterior(a tall, 650-foot black metal cylinder embedded in the ground of a hidden valley),
Interior(a metallic structure of stairs and platforms, with walls filled with mechanical Grim Reaper statues)
],
Theories_and_Discoveries[
Current_Theory(Imperial scientists believe it is a weapon of incalculable power),
Head_Investigator(Doctor Dmitri Duhavel, Freelance Lv. 4, ♂),
Duhavel's_Fear(he suspects the Tower is merely a prototype for an even more powerful weapon called Gravestone)
]
]

24.comment: Location - Mountain Range of Tol Jaegren
24.content:
[Name: Mountain Range of Tol Jaegren]
[Type: Mountain Range / Landmark / POI]
[Parent: Abel]
[Atmosphere: The Tol Jaegren range is a steep and rugged expanse that hums with a dual nature of mundane industry and profound, hidden sanctity. At its accessible lower reaches, it's a place of opportunistic prospecting for gems and crystals. Higher up, its peaks project an aura of immense, undisturbed holiness and ancient secrets, a sacred and challenging domain guarded by both mortal factions and supernatural wards.]
[Data:
Geography(a steep mountain range bordering western Abel with Ilmora and part of Helenia);
Economy(abundant in mines of precious stones and crystals, attracting many prospectors);
Etymology[
True_Meaning(Tol Jaegren is Sylvain for "sacred place"),
Public_Belief(most people in Abel incorrectly assume it was named after a forgotten historical figure)
],
Secret_History[
Sylvain_Temples(before the War of God, the Sylvain built eight temples here: seven for the Beryls and one for C'iel),
War_of_God(the temples of Mikael and Uriel, known as Khitna Misariel and Aerevah Nul, were destroyed by Judas's armies),
Current_State(the other six temples remain standing on the highest peaks),
Guardians(Tol Rauko has kept the temples sealed for centuries and periodically sends agents to inspect them),
Defenses(the temples are protected by Tol Rauko's seals and ancient supernatural safeguards left by Sylvain high priests),
Accessibility(the temples are difficult to find due to the challenging climb and high altitude, unless one knows exactly where to look)
],
Recent_Events(in the last few years, two of the sealed temples have become inhabited by enigmatic settlers from The Wake, whose objectives are unknown)
]

26.comment: Location - The Forest of the Moon

31.location: South of the Tol Jaegren mountains, between Abel and Kanon.

38.content:
[Name: Church of Saint Bernabe]
[Type: Building / Orphanage]
[Parent: Kanon]
[Population: 100+ (mostly children)]
[Atmosphere: The Church of Saint Bernabe is a place of profound warmth and peace. It's a large, welcoming structure set amidst lush green meadows near the coast. The air is filled not with solemn silence, but with the cheerful sounds of children playing. It feels less like an institution and more like a large, happy home—a sanctuary of innocence and kindness.]
[Data:
    History(built two centuries ago to commemorate the birthplace of Father Bernabe);
    Current_Function(serves as a major orphanage for the region);
    Community(houses nearly a hundred children who live happily with their tutors as a family);
    Leadership(run by two young sisters and Father Alexias);
    Key_NPC(Father Alexias; a middle-aged priest, universally loved for his affectionate and good-natured personality);
    Alexias_SECRET[
        True_Identity(one of the most powerful High Inquisitors of the Church),
        Title(The Exterminator Angel),
        Class(Shadow Lv. 11, ♂, Ancient Blood),
        Reputation(feared assassin, brings terror to Samael/Magus/Yehudah),
        Allegiance(serves the Thirteenth Cardinal on special missions),
        Wargear(dark black raincoat, twin Lawgiver pistols 'Umbra' and 'Thanathos'),
        Duality(ruthless and cruel towards the supernatural, warm and affectionate with the children),
        Core_Motivation(the children of the orphanage are his 'guiding light'),
        Current_Conflict(recently executed two Daimah, but secretly adopted their 5-year-old cat-girl daughter),
        Dilemma(is hiding the child at Saint Bernabe, unable to kill her, fears discovery by the Church)
    ]
]

48.content:
[Name: Kanon]
[Type: Principality / Nation]
[Atmosphere: Kanon is a warm, fertile land of vast plains and dense forests, defined by a deep-seated traditionalism in its rural heartlands and the industrious might of its coastal cities. The air carries the scent of the sea and timber from its world-renowned shipyards. A powerful sense of national pride in its naval heritage coexists with a profound, fearful rejection of the supernatural. Beneath a surface of normalcy, there is a palpable tension from recent political turmoil and the looming threat of war with the Azur Alliance on its borders.]
[Data:
    Fact_Sheet[
        Capital(Brudge),
        Population(3,100,000+),
        Ethnic_Groups(Asher 82%, Aion 10%, Vildianos 6%, Daevar 1%),
        Government(Monarchy / Imperial Principality),
        Languages(Latin),
        Religion(Christianity),
        Technology_Level(3),
        Denomym(Kaniano),
        Flag(Blue and white with a boat in the center),
        Masculine_Names(Alesky, Aron, Borys, Celestyn, Dawid, Ferdynand, Gustaw, Ignacy, Iwan, Janek, Kornel, Ludwik, Marek, Miloslaw, Tymon, Witold, Zygfryd),
        Feminine_Names(Ania, Edyta, Ewa, Hania, Kaja, Fight, Malwina, Melania, Wave, Patrycja, Seweryna, Sylwia, Urszula, Waleria, Wiola, Zoja),
        Last_Names(Adamski, Aviza, Bielenda, Ceran, Czekaj, Derda, Dubilas, Faron, Harasym, Jaktorowo, Kalak, Nowak, Parzysz, Polek, Rawa, Tokarski, Wyrostek, Zachemski)
    ],
    Geography_and_Economy[
        Location(southernmost principality of the Sacred Holy Empire),
        Climate(warm, prone to precipitation, fertile land with rich vegetation),
        Terrain(immense deserts, vast plains, dense forests),
        Primary_Industry(famous shipyards producing the world's best boats),
        Revenue_Streams(shipbuilding, fish exports, fees for naval escorts, quality timber),
        Resources(poor in minerals, necessitating metal imports)
    ],
    Government_and_Military[
        Structure(a Prince acts as supreme monarch, advised by a council of senior nobles),
        Ruler(Prince Milek Vanderveer Janssen, known for his pensive behavior),
        Ruler's_Agenda(seeks to acquire greater personal power, causing friction with the aristocracy),
        Military_Focus(a well-trained army that is vastly overshadowed by its navy),
        Naval_Might(Kanon's fleet, combined with the Lord of War's forces, constitutes nearly 70% of the entire Sacred Holy Empire's navy)
    ],
    Sy'luen_Ships[
        Title(The Lords of the Waters),
        Description(extraordinary ships combining advanced aerodynamics with mystical elements),
        Appearance(built from white wood with intricate symbolism on their hulls),
        Performance(extremely fast, incredible handling, highly resistant; none have ever sunk due to natural causes),
        Origin(inspired by ancient Duk'zarist ships, using sacred elven wood as a substitute for Ghestal wood),
        Builders(secrets known only to a few master artisans, who are considered indispensable and are protected by the Knights of the Heaven Order),
        Availability(almost exclusively for Imperial use; rare private commissions require the Prince's express permission and astronomical payment)
    ],
    Culture_and_Society[
        Lifestyle(most citizens are farmers and ranchers in small rural communities),
        Values(strong emphasis on family, tradition, and mutual aid),
        Education(widely seen as a waste of time; parents prefer to pass down practical knowledge),
        Social_Structure(strong feudal system where families owe servitude to a noble house; jobs are typically inherited),
        Social_Mobility(enlisting in the Imperial Navy is a popular and respected way to escape a predetermined life),
        Social_Taboo(marriage between nobility and commoners is strictly forbidden)
    ],
    Supernatural_Views[
        Public_Attitude(closed-minded and fearful; the supernatural is considered a demonic force that brings only death and perversion),
        Church_Doctrine(any unexplainable power is demonic and must be eliminated at its source),
        Public_Reaction(citizens will immediately report suspected witchcraft to The Inquisition; lynchings have occurred),
        The_Sy'luen_Paradox(the ships are built with "limited supernatural formulas," which the Church justifies as "blessings from saints and angels" because the navy is too important to challenge)
    ],
    History[
        Pre-Empire(a wild land of coexisting ethnic groups, dragons, and elementals where the Sylvain failed to unify the territory),
        Rah's_Machine(devastated the supernatural creatures, allowing for human expansion),
        Year_235(became an Imperial Principality under Prince Jareck Stanislaw, who was assassinated by mages),
        The_Janssen_Dynasty(Zhorne appointed Kaz Vanderveer Janssen, who pacified the region by exterminating supernatural entities),
        5th_Century(a boom in coastal cities and Imperial investment led to the creation of its powerful navy),
        Years_652_and_701(victorious wars against Lucrecio with few casualties, arbitrated by the Lords of War)
    ],
    Current_Affairs[
        Recent_Instability(after the death of Emperor Elias Barbados, a secessionist movement by some nobles was quickly quashed by Imperial and Princely forces),
        Ongoing_Tension(some noble families still maintain ties to Togarini and the Azur Alliance),
        Strategic_Threat(faces a probable land invasion from the Azur Alliance, where its powerful navy would be of little use)
    ]
]

49.comment: Landmark - Mountain Range Of The Scar
49.location: Forms the eastern border of Togarini with Kanon.

50.comment: Landmark - The Passage At The End

51.comment: Landmark - Mountain Range of Zhoria (Eastern Zone)

52.comment: Landmark - Mountain Range of Zhoria (Western Zone)

53.content:
[Name: Americh]
[Type: Free Trade City-State]
[Population: 200,000 - 300,000 (and growing)]
[Atmosphere: Americh is a sprawling, chaotic symphony of raw, unrestrained capitalism and desperate freedom. The air is thick with a thousand different smells—exotic spices, street food, spilled ale, refuse, and the faint metallic tang of blood and coin. The city is an architectural nightmare and a marvel of diversity, where opulent palaces stand beside squalid tenements and oriental temples cast shadows on baroque towers. It is a place of boundless opportunity and ever-present danger, where ambition is the only true law and survival is the only true virtue.]
[Data:
    History(one of four great Free Trade Cities, founded by outlaws in the ruins of a city destroyed by Rah's army);
    Geopolitical_Role(an independent city-state located at the convergence of Kanon, Lucrecio, and Bellafonte's borders);
    Inhabitants(a melting pot of assassins, thieves, fugitives from the Church, disgraced nobles, merchants, and mercenaries);
    Governance(ruled by the Council of Commerce, a cabal of eleven powerful bourgeoisie and crime lords);
    Core_Principle(a haven for illegal business and those outside the laws of the Empire and the Church, though basic rules are emerging for stability);
    Architecture(no single style; a chaotic mix of all cultures and designs)
]
[Districts_and_POIs:
    The_High_Area[
        Description(wealthiest district; palaces and private fortresses),
        Inhabitants(Council of Commerce members, powerful business magnates),
        Security(heavily guarded by private mercenary armies),
        Atmosphere(a cold war of constant power struggles, extortion, and assassination between rivals)
    ],
    The_Black_Market[
        Description(a massive, sprawling market of tents and alleys in the grand trade plaza),
        Wares(anything can be bought or sold for the right price, legal or not),
        Danger(thefts and assassinations are commonplace; merchants employ mercenary bodyguards)
    ],
    The_Sniping_Streets[
        Description(a treacherous district of empty streets lined with balconies and windows),
        Danger(a notorious ambush zone where sharpshooters and thieves prey on the unwary),
        Scam(corrupt guides often lead unsuspecting newcomers here to be ambushed by their comrades)
    ],
    The_Contract_Locales[
        Description(the many taverns and inns of the city),
        Function(private backrooms serve as neutral ground for illicit business deals and hiring mercenaries/assassins)
    ],
    The_Good_Neighborhoods[
        Description(the safest, most orderly districts in the city),
        Inhabitants(families and employees of the Council members),
        Law(theft and assassination are banned; justice is swift and delivered by Council-funded mercenaries, as there is no jail)
    ],
    The_Darkness[
        Description(the most dangerous and feared neighborhood, located at the city's ruined core),
        Status(lawless; not even the Council of Commerce has influence here),
        Inhabitants(reclusive wizards, supernatural beings, and others who shun all contact),
        Dangers(terrible rituals and inhuman experiments are common),
        Locals(the only ones who walk the streets are "The Vagabonds," individuals with horrific physical and mental mutations)
    ]
]

86.content:
Type: Road / Trade Route
Condition: Maintained
Description: A Paved Road / Trade Route between Lonel and Londure.

87.content:
Type: Road / Trade Route
Condition: Maintained
Description: A Paved Road / Trade Route between Sepher and Lonel. The majority of this route is sandwitched by an Unnamed Forest in Abel to the south, and the Blathus Mountains to the north.

88.content:
Type: Road / Trade Route
Condition: Maintained
Description: A Paved Road / Trade Route between Bethar and the city of Bryanta

89.content:
Type: Road / Trade Route
Condition: Maintained
Description: A Paved Road / Trade Route between Bryanta and Darel.

90.content:
Type: Road / Trade Route
Condition: Maintained
Description: A Paved Road / Trade Route between Darel and The Woods of Gwenlynn. It leads into a small velley, where the woods are nestled.

91.content:
Type: Road / Trade Route
Condition: Maintained
Description: A Paved Road / Border Route between the city of Bryanta in Abel and the major city of Ogara in Dalaborn.

92.comment: Road - Route of Lucer Abel Archangel-Yirath-PortofEburah
92.content:
Type: Route / POI
Description: The Route of Lucer, probably the longest road in Gaïa, runs along the southern margin of the Zafir River. It connects Archangel with the port of Eburah, crossing through the city of Yirath. It is currently one of the safest and journeyed routes in all the Empire. The traffic of carts, travelers and soldiers usually is heavy.

93.content:
Type: Dirt Path / Mountain Trail
Condition: Rough / Abandoned
Description: A Dirt Path that slowly shifts into a mountail trail as it begins to approach The Mountain Range of Tol Jaegren, before terminating at the Ghost City of Eien.

94.content:
Type: Mountain Trail
Condition: Rough / Natural
Description: The east mountain trail of The Mountain Range of Tol Jaegren. From the 'Path Abel MountainRangeOfTolJaegrenEast 1', it cuts through a small portion of the remaining range before evening out to more level terrain. Afterwards, the rest of the trail cuts across the border into Helenia, where it terminates at The Monastery of SalvatIon.

95.content:
Type: Mountain Trail
Condition: Rough / Natural
Description: The east mountain trail that descends from the peak, then down and across the Mountain Range of Tol Jaegren, it connects to 'Path Abel MountainRangeOfTolJaegrenWest 1' which is the point where the trail begins to eaven out, becoming less treachurous. This path is assumed to be treacherous from the peak, until nearing the end.

96.content:
Type: Mountain Trail
Condition: Rough / Natural
Description: The west mountain trail that climbs up and across the Mountain Range of Tol Jaegren, it connects to 'Path Abel MountainRangeOfTolJaegrenEast 1' which is the point where it reaches the peak before terminating at a mountainous trail down the mountain. Assumed to be trecherous.

97.content:
Type: Dirt Trail
Condition: Rough / Natural
Description: A dirt trail leading towards the Mountain Range of Tol Jaegren, it connects to 'Path Abel MountainRangeOfTolJaegrenWest 1' which is the point where it becomes a mountainous trail up the mountain. Assumed to be trecherous.

98.content:
Type: Dirt Path / Border Path
Condition: Overgrown / Border Path
Description: A path between Sepher and Seifer. It is watched closely, due to it's proximity, as well as it leading into Togarini and the borders of the Azur Alliance.

99.content:
Type: Dirt Path / Forest Trail
Condition: Traveled
Description: A dirt path that starts from where the Forest of Avalbane meets the Eternal Prairie 'Path Abel Eytan-ForestOfAvalbane 1', It continues to bornder the very outskirts of the forest before terminating at Sura.

100.content:
Type: Dirt Path / Forest Trail
Condition: Traveled
Description: A dirt path that starts from Eytan and cuts through the Forest of Avalbane. It terminates outside the forest and at the Eternal Prairie 'Path Abel ForestOfAvalbane-Sura 1', where a new path begins towards Sura.

101.content:
Type: Mountain Trail / Mountain Path
Condition: Rough / Natural
Description: A Mountail Trail cutting through the Blathus Mountains. It connects the roads of 'Road Arlan-Abel Londure-BlathusMountains 1' and 'Road Abel Archangel-BlathusMountains 1'.

102.content:
Type: River
Description: The Calmo River, which feeds from the Mountain Range of The Scar, through Kanon, to the Coast of Yearnings.

103.content:
Type: River
Description: The Calmo River, which feeds from the Mountain Range of The Scar, through Kanon, to the Coast of Yearnings.

104.content:
Type: River / POI
Description: One of the beginnings of the Zafir River, flowing from the Blathus Mountains, and feeding into a larger tributary of the river (River_Abel_ZafirRiver_Fork_2)

105.content:
Type: River / POI
Description: One of the beginnings of the Zafir River, flowing from the Blathus Mountains. It is fed from (River_Abel_ZafirRiver_Fork_1) and feeds into the what many consider the main river (River_Abel_ZafirRiver_Main_1)

107.content:
Type: River / POI
Description: A fork of the Zafir River, feeding into the Coast of Yearnings and The Inner Sea.

108.content:
Type: River / POI
Description: A fork in the Zafir River, flowing from a branch of the river and into the Coast of Yearnings and The Inner Sea. It flows right by the Port of Eburah.
